# Government Tender Announcement: EREP:NFPA Awareness Training

## Announcement Summary

The Public Works and Government Services Canada has issued a Request for Information (RFI) seeking proposals for National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) Awareness Training. The training aims to equip emergency responders with the necessary skills to recognize hazardous materials and respond to emergencies.

## Background Information

The Canadian Coast Guard is the lead federal agency responsible for ensuring the cleanup of pollution spills into Canadian waters. To achieve this, they maintain a level of operational preparedness capacity to monitor, investigate, and respond to marine pollution incidents.

## Requirements

The Canadian Coast Guard is seeking online National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) Awareness training for emergency responders. The training must be designed to prepare personnel who may encounter hazardous materials (HAZMAT) and Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) during their regular duties. The training should also provide participants with certifications bearing an International Fire Service Accreditation Congress (IFSAC) or National Board on Fire Service Professional Qualifications (Pro Board) Seal.

## Response Information

The RFI is not a call for tender or a Request for Proposal (RFP). The Government of Canada does not commit to issuing a subsequent solicitation or awarding contracts based on this RFI. Interested suppliers may submit their responses to:

    Stéphane Monette
    Supply Officer
    Marine Navigation and Remediation Division
    stephane.monette2@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca

*   Tender Closing Date: Not applicable
